website_summaries.verdict: Designed by a CPAP patient, this unique pillow swaps memory foam for cool buckwheat hulls as filler, allowing any sleep position and no hose interference.
pros: User shapes hulls within the case to plump the pillow where needed as well as make a space for the hose
Add or subtract hulls or foam to make pillow thicker or flatter
pillow comes with more than 6 pounds of filler
cons: Sound of the shifting hulls might take some getting used to at first
Cover could stand to be a bit more padded

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold shape, constantly adjustment needed
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this pillow is it settles back into a normal square pillow shape during sleep. The main selling point was that it holds its shape after adjusting it to a cpap mask. For me the result is constantly raising my head to reshape the pillow. Over months this led to serious neck pain. Adjusting my review to three stars because to be fair the pillow is one year old. Also it is probably the best CPAP pillow out there. But it's the best of a bunch of pillow that don't work well - so that's not saying much.
customer_reviews.author: C P

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable firmness and correct alignment do wonders for CPAP!
customer_reviews.text: This pillow has definitely replaced my previous pillow for use with a CPAP. I still need to experiment with the filling level, but after taking about half of it out, it is definitely easier to side sleep with the CPAP and tolerable to sleep on my stomach. This pillow allows you to distribute the filling to make it highly customizable, and this feature makes it much easier to use non-back positions with the CPAP. Although initially it feels stiffer than normal pillows, this did not bother me and it feels like my neck is maintained in great alignment.

customer_reviews.title: The company is fine; the materials are good
customer_reviews.text: The company is fine; the materials are good; the effort is there. But I found the pillow to be very uncomfortable. Thought perhaps I needed to remove some more of the fill material, and I did, but it made the pillow no more comfortable. I tend to fall asleep easily - 10 to 15 minutes at the most, and I'm out. With this pillow, I never did fall asleep. After 20 minutes, my CPAP ramped up, and I've never been able to fall asleep when the pressure is up ... only early on, when the pressure is low. I'm giving 2 stars for the service and quality of build - no stars for performance.

customer_reviews.title: Great results!
customer_reviews.text: I am a male that averaged 25 apneas per hour before cpap. With cpap that went down to about 3 apneas per hour....per nightly computer report. I tried all sorts of cpap pillows and they had no significant effect on that number. With this pillow, I 'm down to .6 apneas per hour for the past 12 days....I just had my first 0 apneas for the entire night. Nothing else has changed in my life. For some reason when I lay on my side, I stay put with this pillow. Please be advised that I am not saying that it will work for everyone.....but it has worked for me.

customer_reviews.text: This pillow has two advantages. 1. It does not let your head sink in and make your CPAP mask develop a leak at night when you are sleeping. 2. customer_reviews.title: Perfect for CPAP
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my CPAP nasal pillow and it's perfect. As a side sleeper, normal pillows make it difficult to get enough clearance for the nasal pillow. This pillow allows you to configure the profile of your pillow precisely by moving the material inside around. The material stays in place once you move it. This provides the benefits of a firm pillow but the comfort of a soft pillow because you create the exact profile that best fits your head. Delivery was quick. Instructions were very helpful. All in all, great buy.

product_meta.title: FaceFit Pillow--Cool, Dry, Adjustable--Bamboo Viscose Cover
product_meta.description: Designed by a CPAP patient and proven and improved on the cpaptalk forum, the Pur-Sleep CPAP pillow uses an innovative, modified buckwheat hull design with a three-layer quilted pillow shell. Buckwheat hulls are shapeable, naturally antimicrobial, hypoallergenic, become polished with use, and stay cool and dry. They allow you to create a nook for your bulky CPAP mask. Three-layer, quilted cotton cover filled with triple-cleaned, natural, buckwheat hulls, blended with foam for added comfort - Gusset design plus shapeable fill conforms to any shape and holds that shape all night long - With a large zipper opening, it's fully adjustable to suit ANY sleeping position-side, back, or stomach - Extra filling provided so your pillow will never go flat. - Extra shredded foam available for comfort adjustment - Fill does not push back against your head, so there are no pressure points and no sore neck Fits Any Standard Pillow Case Machine Washable 10 Year Warranty PATENTS PENDING
